content.raw: Yes, that would be good indeed. We could subscribe to the contacts topic, update a world with a still standing body on the ground floor (which is thus disabled after one or a few iterations) and expect at least one contact message with that body to arrive each time an update was done. To simulate a remote connection (so that `SubscribersConnected()` returns true) we could take the same approach with forking as in pull request #2657. Would that be an appropriate test? If you think this sounds good, I'll write it and add it to this PR.
